text: many years ago my dad ran various small
steel factories and the like and he
briefly took over a small magnet making
factory and he gave me a handful of
magnets that they made most of them
little ones but one of them was this
giant horseshoe magnet with a keeper so
it's painted red it's like the magnet
that you'd have in a cartoon with some
wavy lines coming out of it to show
magnetism with the keeper on the bottom
and this has become known in my house
sits on a shelf out of reach for the
most part it's called danger magnet
because it's so strong that if you hold
the magnet and the keeper that's the bit
that you put across the two poles if you
bring them together and you've got your
finger in the way but about that
distance it suddenly goes bang on your
finger I've only done it worked and it
hurts like hell it's so strong and it's
so strong that actually it's quite a
risky thing to handle I know that sounds
stupid it's just a magnet this is a
train which is running on electric
motors which rely on the principle of
magnetism and the electro-motive force
to work we could thank Tesla and
Westinghouse from us and work on that I
think that's right as well yes anyway
where was I on yes this there's a danger
magnet is it is only a magnet he doesn't
sound very threatening but it is so
strong that you do actually have to
handle it quite carefully because if you
stride past the fridge which is made of
mild steel and therefore very magnetic
with this thing in your hand you will be
walking normal and then bang your arm is
attached to the fridge if you get
anything stuck on danger magnet it's
very difficult to get it off a paperclip
or especially anything like metal
filings if they're on there you're not
gonna get them off you're not gonna go
to pull them off with your fingers it's
impossible it's so powerful I think it
may actually be slightly affecting the
rotation of the earth and interfering
with time itself it's why I haven't aged
as much as my colleagues
